GDPH nurses and staff will offer free COVID-19 tests at Ringgold United Methodist Church on Mondays and Tuesdays of each month and the first and third Saturdays of each month from 9:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. and 12:30 to 4:30 p.m. This new schedule will begin on Tuesday, September 1. There will be no testing available on Saturday, September 5, but testing will resume Labor Day, September 7 and Saturday, September 19.

Anyone wishing to receive a free COVID-19 test at Ringgold United Methodist Church must enter from the Cleveland Street entrance. For more information, call (706) 295-6704 or visit www.nwgapublichealth.org.

The repairs underway on East Nickajack Road going up Taylor's Ridge are using a technique called "burrito wraps".
A track hoe rigged with a drilling machine drives long steel pins into the ground and fills the holes with grout. This helps to stabilize the soil. Then, workers pile on layers of stone and heavy sheeting, and wrap those layers like a burrito to add even more stability along the side of the road.
The job will continue with soil stabilization further down the slope, and when completed there will be a new road surface.
We appreciate everyone's patience as this work continues, and please slow down is all work zones.
#roadrepair #roadconstruction #SlopeProtection #slopefail #catoosastrong

Notice is hereby given that the Board of Commissioners of Catoosa County, Georgia will hold a public hearing on Tuesday, March 3, 2020 at 6:00 p.m. in the Catoosa County Administration Building, 800 Lafayette Street, Ringgold, Georgia.
